main event: An unidentified luminous object resembling a vapor trail was observed in Southern Norway on 8 May 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as mirror bright and observed for almost 10 minutes., It was reported by multiple witnesses from different locations including Bergen and Sola., One witness stated the object appeared to explode, leaving behind a cloud., The object was also likened to a vapor trail and was still visible for almost thirty minutes., The conclusion regarded the phenomena as possibly explained but insufficient to definitively identify it.
sighted object: luminous object resembling a vapor trail
witness description: multiple witnesses reported sightings from various locations
